name: Victim Friendly Unit
description: These are special departments in Zim Police trained to handle GBV cases. We encourage that you visit any Police station and mention specifically that you want to speak with anyone from VFU

name: Mbare Clinic Clinic For Survivors
description: Its open everyday and ready to help any survivor of gbv

name: Musasa Project
description: Deals with relief to survivors of GBV
address: Harare : 64 Selous Ave/ Cnr 7th street | Bulawayo : 49 Fife Ave

name: SALT (Someone Always Listens Toyou)
description: Dedicated team ready to help you with crisis calls such as GBV, stress anxiety, greef and other crisis

name: Adult Rape Clinic
description: ARC provides free medical and psycho-social care to both male and female victims

name: ROOTS
description: ROOTS provides victims with a place they can breathe, heal and explore their options

name: Fathers Against Abuse
description: Encourages and challenge all man to take a stance to campaign for the end of GBV

name: Padare
description: Movement of men advocating for gender justice
address: Harare : 10 Cardigan Road, Belvedere | Gweru : 49 1028 Leeds Road, Light Industries

name: One Stop Centres
description: The Zimbabwe Government launched One Stop Centres to assist victims of GBV
address: Harare : 64 Selous Ave/ Cnr 7th street | Chipinge : Chipinge District Hospital | Rusape : Rusape General Hospital | Gwanda : Gwanda Provincial Hospital | Gweru : Gweru Provincial Hospital

name: Bantwana
description: Bantwana Gender Based Violence Prevention and Response Program supports local Zimbabwean organizations and governments to prevent and respond to GBV against adolescent girls

name: Shamwari Yemwana Sikana (SYS)
description: Promotes Rights and empowerment of the girl child. Can help female victims

name: UNICEF Zimbabwe
description: UNICEF Zimbabwe is ready to help victims and survivors
